alert.note: Alert for Addison; Chittenden; Franklin; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Rutland; Washington; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:29PM EST until February 19 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... West central Orange County in central Vermont... Northwestern Orleans County in northeastern Vermont... Addison County in central Vermont... Northeastern Rutland County in southern Vermont... Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Northwestern Windsor County in southern Vermont... Washington County in central Vermont... Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 215 PM EST. * At 127 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Fairfax to Shoreham, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility of less than one quarter mile in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 51 and 130. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Burlington International Airport, Middlebury, South Burlington, Burlington, Vergennes, Montpelier, Morrisville, Enosburg Falls, Franklin, Jay, Braintree Hill, Cambridge, Salisbury, Waterbury Village, Montgomery Center, Westford, Colchester, Essex Junction Village and Worcester. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Addison; Chittenden; Franklin; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Rutland; Washington; Windsor
